data.enText: a situation in which a group of people behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest

data.chText: 一位狱警在监狱骚乱中遇难。
data.enText: One prison guard was killed when a riot broke out in the jail.

data.chText: 争抢食物的暴乱；种族骚乱
data.enText: food/race riots
a collection of a lot of different types of the same thing
The garden was a riot of colour .
a person or an event that is very amusing and enjoyable
run riot
to behave in a way that is violent and/or not under control

data.chText: 他们听任自己的孩子撒野。
data.enText: They let their kids run riot.

data.chText: （指想象、情感等）任意发挥，奔放
data.enText: if your imagination, a feeling, etc. runs riot , you allow it to develop and continue without trying to control it
to grow and spread quickly
read (sb) the Riot Act
to tell sb with force that they must not do sth

data.chText: 源自1715年通过的防止暴乱的议会法案。法案规定如果十二名或以上的人集结，在宣布解散命令并宣读相关条文后仍拒绝解散，则视为非法。
data.enText: From an Act of Parliament passed in 1715 to prevent riots. It made it illegal for a group of twelve or more people to refuse to split up if they were ordered to do so and part of the Act was read to them.
to behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest

data.chText: 暴徒放火焚烧停着的汽车。
data.enText: Rioters set fire to parked cars.
Rioting broke out in the capital.

ex.chText: 上星期政府镇压了一次武装叛乱。
ex.enText: The government put down an armed rebellion last week.

ex.chText: 谁在幕后策划了反对该军事政权的暴动？
ex.enText: Who was behind the rebellion against the military regime?

synonyms.bx: 指以推翻政府或统治者为目的的有组织的武装反叛。

ex.chText: 该事件标志着殖民地人民的反抗行动获得成功。
ex.enText: This event marked the successful revolt/rebellion of the colonies.

ex.chText: 那场叛乱是何时被镇压的？

synonyms.bx: 多指针对政府的武装斗争，涉及范围较小，可与 rebellion 换用。

ex.chText: 他的死亡引发了一场严重的监狱暴乱。
ex.enText: His death triggered a vicious prison riot.

ex.chText: 要采取有效措施避免难民营中发生争抢食物的骚乱。
ex.enText: Effective measures should be taken to avoid food riots in the refugee camp.

synonyms.bx: 尤指一群人为抗议某事而引发的骚乱。

ex.chText: 这一章大致介绍了南昌起义。
ex.enText: This chapter gives a general introduction to the Nanchang Uprising.

ex.chText: 最近这次平民暴动是由一位农民的儿子领导的。
ex.enText: The recent popular uprising was led by a peasant's son.

synonyms.bx: 指某一地区或国家的人为推翻政府、政权等而进行的武装暴动。

data.enText: run riot
to behave in a way that is violent and/or not under control

data.chText: 他们听任自己的孩子撒野。
data.enText: They let their kids run riot.

data.chText: （指想象、情感等）任意发挥，奔放
data.enText: if your imagination, a feeling, etc. runs riot , you allow it to develop and continue without trying to control it
to grow and spread quickly
read (sb) the Riot Act
to tell sb with force that they must not do sth

data.chText: 源自1715年通过的防止暴乱的议会法案。法案规定如果十二名或以上的人集结，在宣布解散命令并宣读相关条文后仍拒绝解散，则视为非法。
data.enText: From an Act of Parliament passed in 1715 to prevent riots. It made it illegal for a group of twelve or more people to refuse to split up if they were ordered to do so and part of the Act was read to them.

tr: a wild gathering involving excessive drinking and promiscuity
a public act of violence by an unruly mob
a joke that seems extremely funny
a state of disorder involving group violence

example: They were out carousing last night

tr: disturb the public peace by engaging in a riot

value.def: When there is a riot, a crowd of people behave violently in a public place, for example they fight, throw stones, or damage buildings and vehicles.

example.ex: Twelve inmates have been killed during a riot at the prison.
example.tran: 12名犯人在一场监狱暴乱中被杀害。

value.def: If people riot, they behave violently in a public place.

example.ex: Last year 600 inmates rioted, starting fires and building barricades...
example.tran: 去年，600名犯人闹事，他们纵火并设置路障。

example.ex: They rioted in protest against the government.
example.tran: 他们发动暴乱，以抗议政府的行为。

example.ex: At least fifteen people are now known to have died in three days of rioting.
example.tran: 目前已知至少有15人在持续了3天的暴乱中丧生。

value.def: If you say that there is a riot of something pleasant such as colour, you mean that there is a large amount of various types of it.

example.ex: All the cacti were in flower, so that the desert was a riot of colour...
example.tran: 所有的仙人掌都开花了，整个沙漠里五彩缤纷。

example.ex: With Indian cuisine, you expect a riot of tastes and spices.
example.tran: 印度菜肴口味丰富，并添加各种香料。

value.tran: 五颜六色;丰富多彩;各种各样

value.def: If someone in authority reads you the riot act, they tell you that you will be punished unless you start behaving properly.

example.ex: I'm glad you read the riot act to Billy. He's still a kid and still needs to be told what to do.
example.tran: 我很高兴你警告比利不许胡闹。他还是个孩子，仍然需要有人告诉他该做什么。

value.tran: 严厉警告…停止闹事;严厉警告…注意言行

value.def: If people run riot, they behave in a wild and uncontrolled manner.

example.ex: Rampaging prisoners ran riot through Strangeways jail.
example.tran: 斯特兰韦斯监狱里那些狂暴的囚犯们全都失去了控制。

value.tran: 失去控制;变得狂乱;无法无天

value.def: If something such as your imagination runs riot, it is not limited or controlled, and produces ideas that are new or exciting, rather than sensible.

example.ex: A conservatory offers the perfect excuse to let your imagination run riot.
example.tran: 音乐学院让你有充分的理由任想象力自由驰骋。

example.ex: We have no proof and when there is no proof, rumour runs riot.
example.tran: 我们没有证据，只要没有证据，谣言就会满天飞。

value.tran: (想象力等)狂野，不受拘束，任意发挥

trans: 失去控制;变得狂乱;无法无天；(想象力等)狂野，不受拘束，任意发挥
取缔闹事法；骚扰取缔令
